bioghist.p: Martha Loder (b. 1914) was born in Bridgeton, New Jersey. She received her bachelor's degree from Dickinson College, where she was a member of the Phi Beta Kappa Honors fraternity. She continued her education at the University of Pennsylvania and in 1943, earned her Ph.D. in romance languages. The subject of her doctoral thesis was Leon Gozlan (1808-1866), a French playwright and novelist. After graduation, Loder became head of the English department at Bridgeton High School. On March 4, 1950, she earned the American Legion Award of Merit for distinguished service.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Martha Loder's research notes on Leon Gozlan, his wife Marie Agathe Christine Rapharel, their daughter Agathe Leontine Gozlan, and their son-in-law Charles Jerome Alphonse Duval. Materials include: modern copies of or extracts from marriage, baptismal, birth, and death certificates of Gozlan and Duval family members; a lithograph caricature of Leon Gozlan; a photocopy of a manuscript and typed transcription of a writing by Gozlan on French drama; and letters from Loder to churches and government offices requesting documentation on Gozlan and Duval family members.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
